message.content: Caveat: The messages below were generated by the user while running local commands. DO NOT respond to these messages or otherwise consider them in your response unless the user explicitly asks you to.

analyze @src/components/vue/views/home/WorkflowsSection.vue . when on dark mode i can see the bubble container for each animation, however when on light mode i cant see the bubble container at all because i think its because its the same color.

content.text: I'll analyze the WorkflowsSection.vue file to understand the dark mode vs light mode styling issue with the bubble containers.

Perfect! I found the issue. Looking at the styling in `WorkflowsSection.vue`:

## Problem Analysis

**Light Mode (default):**
- Line 170: `background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.05);` - This is **white** with only 5% opacity
- Line 172: `border: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1);` - White border with 10% opacity
- On a light/white background, these are nearly invisible!

**Dark Mode:**
- Line 231: `background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);` - Black with 20% opacity
- Line 232: `border-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.05);` - White border with 5% opacity
- This works because the contrast is visible against the dark background

## The Issue

The default (light mode) styles use **white** colors (`255, 255, 255`) which blend into a white/light background. You need the inverse - darker colors for light mode.

input.plan:
# Fix Theater Container Visibility in Light Mode

## Problem
The `.theater-stage` containers are invisible in light mode because they use white colors (`rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.05)`) that blend into the light background.

## Solution
Swap the color logic so that:
- **Light mode (default)**: Use dark/gray colors for visibility on light backgrounds
- **Dark mode**: Keep the current white-tinted colors

## Changes to `src/components/vue/views/home/WorkflowsSection.vue`

Update lines 168-173 to use dark colors for light mode:
```css
.theater-stage {
  min-height: 400px;
  background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05);  /* Change: Dark background for light mode */
  backdrop-filter: blur(20px);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);  /* Change: Dark border for light mode */
  border-radius: 24px;
  /* ... rest stays same ... */
}
```

Update lines 230-233 to override with light colors for dark mode:
```css
:global([data-theme="dark"]) .theater-stage {
  background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.08);  /* Change: Light background for dark mode */
  border-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.15);  /* Change: Light border for dark mode */
}
```

This will make the containers visible on both light and dark backgrounds with appropriate contrast.
